intro: Alloplectus pallidus, commonly known as the pale sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, pale green to yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. Alloplectus pallidus is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to harsh, dry conditions.
